climbs.name: Succubus
climbs.fa: James Olsen and Martin Borch Jensen

content.description: Climb the chimney.  There is a crack in front of you that goes all the way to the top with generally secure pro placements.  Once past the chimney climb the crack to the top.  The crux consists of about an 8 or 10 foot segment in the upper section.  It can be a little hard on the hands.  You can walk down the backside after one or two moves off the summit block (Start exit off back around the North side.
content.protection: Most of a standard cam rack will suffice.  Bring an extra #3 if you have it.  Secure belay position with cams at the top.
content.location: Succubus is on the steepest dark rock (Dark Minion Crag) on the right side of the road hike uphill about 100 yards to the crag.  It has a face parallel to the road with a  detached pillar in front of it that goes about halfway to the top.

content.description: Desert area, lower and dryer than Santa Fe. Just off a dirt road, but quiet. Devil's Throne is the large crag on your left about 3/4 mile outside of Cerrillos.  Dark Minion is the smaller crag on the right.  It's the steepest rock on the right side of the road.
